intro: Galium atropatanum, commonly known as black nightshade or purple bedstraw, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its fruits are small, dry berries that turn red or black as they mature. Galium atropatanum is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
